sentences.en: A good - natured But indolent hanger - on.
sentences.cn: 心地善良但是懒惰的食客.

sentences.en: A literary image erases the more indolent images of perception.
sentences.cn: 文学意象抹除那些感官的懒惰意象.

sentences.en: He is old and fat and indolent.
He is old, fat and indolent.
He quickens the indolent, encourages the eager, and steadies the unstable.
sentences.cn: 他使懒惰的活跃, 使热心的获鼓励, 使摇摆者稳定.

sentences.en: I don't want to make friends with indolent persons.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢和懒惰的人交朋友。

sentences.en: In a 1942 presentation at the New York Academy of Medicine, the scientists reported that after lobotomy, patients did sometimes become “indolent” or “outspoken.
sentences.cn: 在1942年纽约医学专科学院的一个介绍会中，一些科学家提出，额叶切除术后，病人的确有时变得“懒惰”或“直言”。

sentences.en: Once two indolent people in the seats next to theirs delayed them, and the newsreel started.
sentences.cn: 一次坐在他们旁边的两个懒人让他们耽搁了一会儿，新闻短片开始了。

sentences.en: St. Clare was indolent and careless of money.
sentences.cn: 圣·克莱亚为人懒散,挥金如土.

sentences.en: The former investment banker has not been indolent: his department has been a factory for acronyms since the crisis began.
sentences.cn: 这位前投资银行家并非懒惰，自危机开始以来，他的部门已成为加工厂的代称。

sentences.en: The sultry weather in the tropics encourages tourists to lead an indolent life.
sentences.cn: 热带闷热的气候使得游客只能过懒散的生活.

sentences.en: The writer said he needed some goad because he was indolent.
sentences.cn: 这个作家说他需要刺激,因为他很懒惰.

sentences.en: They are as heedless and as indolent as cats.
sentences.cn: 他们都和猫儿一样,懒惰驯良.

sentences.en: They are indolent, as a general thing, and yet have a few pastimes.
sentences.cn: 一般说来, 他们总是懒洋洋的, 但倒有几种解闷的法子.

sentences.en: Those who revel in the Internet tend to lead an indolent life.
sentences.cn: 沉迷于网络的人往往过着懒散的生活.

sentences.en: To move, stand, or recline in an indolent or relaxed manner.
sentences.cn: 懒洋洋地闲荡懒洋洋地或放松地移动 、 站立或斜倚.

sentences.en: You're too fastidious, and too indolent, and too rich.
sentences.cn: 你们从不知足, 而且游手好闲, 钱又太多.

trans.tran_cn: 懒惰的，懒散的，不活跃的
